en: Is there not a warfare to man upon earth? And are not his days like the days of a hireling?
hmr: “Hnuoi chunga hin mihriem chun sin thaw ding a nei zing ni lo am a nih? A nihai khawm chu inhlawfa ni ang a ni naw am a nih?

en: As a servant that earnestly desireth the shadow, And as a hireling that looketh for his wages:
hmr: Siehlaw, deihlim inhnar ngâwi ngâwi angin le, Inhlâwfa a hlawhai ngawt en ang el chun:

en: So am I made to possess months of misery, And wearisome nights are appointed to me.
hmr: Thla teplohai chu hmang dinga siem ka na, Zân tuorhlaumtakhai chu ka ta dinga ruot a ni tah a.

en: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? And I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
hmr: Ka zâl pha chun, ‘Iengtik am tho ka tih aw? Zân chu a sâwt ngei,’ ka tih a; Zîngkhaw hung var chenin kân let kân let a.

en: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; My skin closeth up, and breaketh out afresh.
hmr: Ka taksa chu pilvut khâwnhai le ngêhaia thuomin a um a; Ka vun chu a hung inhlip a, a tharin a hung suok tah a.

en: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And are spent without hope.
hmr: Ka nihai chu puon khâwngtu khawthei nêkin a hrât lem a; Beiseina hrim um loa sukthâm an nih.

en: Oh remember that my life is a breath: Mine eye shall no more see good.
hmr: Aw, ka hringna hi thli el a nih ti hre zing la, Ka mit hin thil ṭha hmu nâwk ta naw nih.

en: The eye of him that seeth me shall behold me no more; Thine eyes shall be upon me, but I shall not be.
hmr: Mit a mi hmutu khan mi hmu ta naw nih a; I mithaiin mi hung en a ta, nisienlakhawm, um ta naw ning.

en: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away, So he that goeth down to Sheol shall come up no more.
hmr: Sûm chu a hung inzâm a, a hung ral angin; Chuong ang chun, Seola fetahai chu hung nâwk ta naw ni hai.

en: He shall return no more to his house, Neither shall his place know him any more.
hmr: A ina chun hung kîr ta naw nih a; A hmun chun ama chu hre ta bawk naw ni.

en: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
hmr: “Chuleiin, ka bau hi insûm naw ning a, Ka thlarau thuokdawng hin thu hril ka tih; Ka lungril rimsiknaa hin sawisêl ka tih.

en: Am I a sea, or a sea-monster, That thou settest a watch over me?
hmr: Tuisuoriet am ka ni, tuisuorieta ngapui am ka ni. Keima chunga vêngtu i sie chu?

en: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, My couch shall ease my complaint;
hmr: ‘Ka khumin mi sukhlim a ta, Ka zâlkhum chun ka sawisêlna chu mi suknêppêk a tih,’ ka ti hlak chun.

en: Then thou scarest me with dreams, And terrifiest me through visions:
hmr: Nangin manghaiin i mi suklâu a; Mitthlaa thilhmuhaiin i mi sukṭih a.

en: So that my soul chooseth strangling, And death rather than these my bones.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka lungril chun inâwkhlum le thina a thlang a nih; Hieng ka ruhai ngawt nêk hin chu.

en: I loathe my life; I would not live alway: Let me alone; for my days are vanity.
hmr: Ka hringna chu ka sêngral a; dam sâwt naw ningah, Mâkhâtin mîn umtir el rawh; ka nihai chu teplo el an ni sih a.

en: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him, And that thou shouldest set thy mind upon him,
hmr: Mihriem hi ieng am a nih a, ama chu i chawimawi a; Amaa chun i lungril în nghat a,

en: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, And try him every moment?
hmr: Zîng tin ela i hung sir hlak a, Mitkhapkâr tina i fie hlak hi?

en: How long wilt thou not look away from me, Nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
hmr: Iengchen am keia tieng ngha lo loin um i ta, Ka chil lem kâr el khawma makhâta i mîn umtir naw ding chu?

en: If I have sinned, what do I unto thee, O thou watcher of men? Why hast thou set me as a mark for thee, So that I am a burden to myself?
hmr: Ka lo suol a ni khawmin, i chungah ieng am ka thaw a na, Aw, Nang mihriemhai vêngtu? Iengdinga nanga ta dinga inchikna dinga i mi sie am a na? Keima ngei ta dinga phurrik ni elna dingin.

en: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? For now shall I lie down in the dust; And thou wilt seek me diligently, but I shall not be.
hmr: Iengdinga ka bawsietna hi i ngaidam nawh a, Ka rîtlona hi i lâk hmang naw? Tuhin pilvut lai ka zâl el ding an ta sih a; Ngûntakin mi zawng i ta, nisienlakhawm, um ta naw ningah,” tiin.
